data: {"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3153897,"name":"","username":"jdsp511","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/e0b2c6/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-02-27T19:55:43.127Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eWe are using REV MAXSwerve this year and are having an issue with one of our steering motors/controllers. While testing an unrelated subsystem, I noticed that one of the wheels was not turning with the others and was just dragging across the ground. Looking at the SparkMAX showed no errors/fault codes on the LED. However, it can’t be accessed over USB through the REV hardware client (can be accessed over CAN by plugging into a different SparkMAX).\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eI also noticed that the NEO 550 the SparkMAX was plugged into was hot (unplugged motor immediately). A reflash, recovery, and a restore to factory defaults changed nothing. Interestingly, when reinstalling the firmware with recovery mode, the SparkMAX showed up as a generic device in recovery mode and I had to select the device type manually (in the docs, the SparkMAX appears to be automatically recognized in recovery mode).\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eIs this a hardware failure? :((( We don’t have any extra SparkMAXes left and this will really hamper driver practice if so.\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":2,"updated_at":"2023-02-27T19:55:43.127Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":74,"readers_count":73,"score":29.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":428340,"topic_slug":"sparkmax-cant-be-accessed-over-usb-and-driven-neo-550-is-hot-is-this-a-sparkmax-failure","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56126,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/sparkmax-cant-be-accessed-over-usb-and-driven-neo-550-is-hot-is-this-a-sparkmax-failure/428340/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3319140,"name":"system","username":"system","avatar_template":"/uploads/default/original/4X/9/3/2/93234578e69f55873c63fc00fe2d0d85f23bce55.png","created_at":"2024-02-27T19:56:25.660Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eThis topic was automatically closed 365 days after the last reply.
